content: How to check if a neural network has learned a specific phenomenon?
title: AI coffe break: notes1

content: Question: How do we check if a neural network trained on task A has learned a phenomenon specific to task B? To NLP, the task is called probing/diagnostic classifier/probing task.
title: AI coffe break: notes1

content: How do we do probing? Freeze the parameters of Input layer and Hidden layers, Replace the last layers to Probing layers, Train the Probing layers on a small dataset If task A is Masked word prediction and task B is Sentiment analysis, then:
title: AI coffe break: notes1

content: Most recently research paper: Information-Theoretic Probing with Minimum Description Length on

content: A three moths schedule for Machine Learning Foundations.
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock

content: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock A three moths schedule for Machine Learning Foundations.
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock

content: 1. Introduction Nowadays Machine learning and Deep learning are widely used in all subjects, both industry and research organizations take huge effort to apply these methods. I major in Information Management and Information System for my undergraudate study, and had some research experience related to Natural language Processing. I’m quite excited to study in the area of AI, especially in NLP/CL，since there are so many great contributors and huge progressed they’ve achieved. More is Less and Less is More! I believe that no matter how fast this field is growing, the most important thing we can do is to build a good foundation if we want to dive into it.
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock

content: 2. Planning Thanks to an UP(NLP从入门到放弃) share his great learning experience bilibili, I decided to follow his guide and start my 3 moths ML schedule. There 6 modules in this guide for about 3 months.
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock

content: 2.1 Prerequisites Week 1: Python Week 2: Python for data analysis Week3: Math(Linear Algebra, Calculus, Probability)
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock

content: 2.2 ML Theory Book : Statistical learning methods by Hang Li Must-learn chapter Introduction Perceptron Naive Bayes Decision Tree Logistic Regression and MaxEnt Boosted Trees XGBoost Reference Blog: Jianping Liu’s Blog Principle Can derive formulas by yourself. Don‘t read every chapter in this book except for the must-learns'. Don‘t reinvent wheels
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock

content: 2.3 ML Practice Alibaba Cloud TIANCHI Industrial steam volume forecast Repeat purchase prediction for Tmall users O2O Coupon Forecast Ali cloud security malicious program detection
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock

content: 2.4 DL Theory CV - cs231n P1-P22 HW1,HW2 NLP - cs224n P1-P5 & P8,P9,P11 HW Pytorch Learning Bilibili 刘二大人 A repo
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock

content: 2.5 DL Practice NLP Ali Cloud Tianchi: News Text Categories CV Ali Cloud Tianchi: Streetscape symbol recognition
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock

content: 2.6 Interview Questions Book: The Quest for Machine Learning
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock

content: 3. Note Every time I have finished some in this schedule, I’ll post it to my blog.
title: Build Your Machine Learning on the Rock
